page.title: 14SMITHY COTTAGE
page.content: Mrs.Lees, who used to work in our school (as ancilliary assistant) lives in Smithy Cottage which got its name because at one time the blacksmith, Mr.Broad, used to live there. Mr and Mrs Foster lived there after the black- smith and they pulled it down and then rebuilt it all again with the same bricks. The original house was built 300 years ago, and at that time the roof was thatched and the walls were made of wattle and daub (mud). In those days people were smaller and that is why the houses were smaller. There are fences around the windows, because when horses were coming for new shoes, they poked their noses through the windows. The floors are at different levels as it is said that if thieves got in they would be caught off guard and the people inside would be ready for them.
